definition: homesick
to think/to believe/to suppose/to wish/to want/to miss (feel wistful about the absence of sb or sth)

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
thinker
impractical dreamer
dreamer/visionary

sentences.english: Yeah, I get homesick at least twice a quarter, I think.
sentences.chinese: 想，我每個季度至少想家兩次。

sentences.english: Again dissolute drift on water unruly, always there is time of homesick.
sentences.chinese: 再放蕩不羈的漂泊者，總有想家的時候。

sentences.english: I stayed awake because of missing home last night.
I think he's ok but he's a bit homesick now.
sentences.chinese: 我想他沒事，但他現在有點想家。

sentences.english: The letter had made Edmond heart sick and home sick.
sentences.chinese: 這封信讓埃德蒙心痛和想家。

sentences.english: I missing U so much, my dearest.
sentences.chinese: 觸景生情，我也很想家吖。

sentences.english: Believe it or not, I am feeling very homesick.
sentences.chinese: 信不信由你，反正我現在非常想家。

sentences.english: I’m just feeling homesick I guess.
They are out long-term, but they also have the impulse to home.
sentences.chinese: 他們長期在外，但是他們也會有想家的衝動。

sentences.english: He left his job largely because he was homesick.
sentences.chinese: 他辭職不幹主要是因爲他想家。

sentences.english: You’re away at school and miss home.
sentences.chinese: 遠離學校擬在大學讀書，你很想家。

sentences.english: The students began to feel homesick after they had been here for a month.
sentences.chinese: 到了這裏一個月以後，學生們開始想家了。

sentences.english: I was feeling really homesick but you cheered me up.
sentences.chinese: 我最近特別想家，但是你讓我振作起來了。

definition: to miss/to remember with longing/to long to see again
home-loving/to feel a strong attachment to home life/to begrudge being away from home
foreign land/a place far from home
doubly homesick for our dear ones at each festive day (from a poem by Wang Wei 王維|王维[Wang2 Wei2])
pinyin: mei3 feng2 jia1 jie2 bei4 si1 qin1

definition: a stranger in a strange land (from a poem by Wang Wei 王維|王维[Wang2 Wei2])
pinyin: du2 zai4 yi4 xiang1 wei2 yi4 ke4

definition: to be homesick
lone/lonely/loneliness
person living or traveling far from home
to constantly have (sb or sth) on one's mind
concerned
to drift (in the tide)/to rove/to lead a wandering existence/drifter/wanderer
to leave one's homeland
to worry about/to be concerned about
circumstances that evoke mixed feelings (idiom)
to think of/to long for/to miss
to feel sad/to feel unwell/(of life) to be difficult
